snippet: Algirdas Semeta, the European commissioner drafting the rules, said the levy on financial transactions was “fully compliant with international tax law.”
abstract: European regulators defend plans to create first international tax on financial transactions after business groups in United States warn levy could break international agreements.
lead_paragraph: Algirdas Semeta, the European commissioner drafting the rules, said the levy on financial transactions was “fully compliant with international tax law.”

headline.seo: Europe Rejects Critics of ‘Robin Hood’ Tax
headline.main: Europe Rejects Critics of ‘Robin Hood’ Tax
headline.print_headline: European Regulators Defend Tax on Stock and Bond Transactions
